title: Attorney General Morrisey Shatters Multiple Records for West Virginia in 2023
text:
CHARLESTON, WV (WVDN) ‚Äî West Virginia Attorney General Patrick Morrisey‚Äôs office kept up a vigorous fight against opioid abuse, sought to beat back the Biden Administration‚Äôs overreaching energy policies that could destroy jobs and continued to combat assaults on the Second Amendment.
Arguably, the Attorney General‚Äôs biggest accomplishment was reaching the nearly $1 billion mark in settlements with opioid manufacturers, retail pharmacies such as Kroger and Walgreens, and distributors, the highest per capita opioid settlements in the nation. In 2023, Attorney General Morrisey did not relent in his committed fight against opioid abuse.
Earlier this year, the Attorney General‚Äôs Office and officials in every level of government in West Virginia secured the highest per capita opioid settlements in the nation‚Äîthis was preceded by the creation of a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the state and most county and city governments throughout West Virginia to make sure opioid settlement funds are distributed in the fairest, equitable and evidence-based way.
In addition to settlements and establishing the MOU, he continued drug abuse prevention outreach efforts to students, including the 7th annual ‚ÄúKids Kick Opioids‚Äù PSA Contest and high school football ‚ÄúGames of the Week‚Äù in the fall. The Attorney General in 2023 fought for the rights of biological women in sports to not have to compete against biological males. This battle sought to ensure that girls and women get their fair share of opportunities in scholastic sports, and Title IX‚Äôs regulations make it clear that this could be accomplished in school athletic programs by having ‚Äòseparate teams for members of each sex‚Äô where the teams are based on competitive skill.
In October, the Attorney General defended West Virginia‚Äôs Save Women‚Äôs Sports Act and the Office‚Äôs district court victory earlier this year in the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important to keep safeguarding Title IX and protecting women‚Äôs sports so that females have a truly fair playing field,‚Äù Attorney General Morrisey said. ‚ÄúThe Act protects that fair playing field‚Ä¶ We stand by the January decision that this law is constitutional.‚Äù The Attorney General co-led a coalition of more than 20 states in a lawsuit against the EPA, asking a federal court to vacate the Biden administration‚Äôs final rule redefining Waters of the United States (WOTUS) and declare it unlawful. The U.S. District Court for the District of North Dakota subsequently issued a preliminary injunction against the Biden administration‚Äôs WOTUS rule, and the Supreme Court then ruled that federal jurisdiction over wetlands and streams only applies with those that have a ‚Äúcontinuous surface connection‚Äù with traditionally navigable waters of the United States.
The EPA‚Äôs proposed new rule on car tailpipes aims to boost electric vehicle sales from 8.4% of total vehicle sales today to 67% by 2032. The Attorney General co-led with Kentucky a coalition of 25 states in a comment letter to the EPA, telling the agency Congress did not give the EPA the power to attempt a top-to-bottom restructuring of the automobile industry. The coalition urged the EPA to instead adopt ‚Äúfeasible standards that maintain our nation‚Äôs air quality without risking consumer safety, economic stability and national security,‚Äù describing the proposal as ‚Äúunlawful, unwise and unsustainable.‚Äù
The Attorney General led a coalition of 21 states opposing a proposed rule by the EPA on existing coal-, natural gas- and oil-fired power plants that would regulate those plants under the Clean Air Act by imposing more stringent emissions standards, utterly ignoring last year‚Äôs West Virginia v. EPA , which warned that EPA should not use a narrow regulatory provision to force coal-fired power plants into retirement en masse. The proposal would strip states of discretion while using technologies that don‚Äôt work in the real world. It sets up the plants to fail to meet the standards dictated in the rule, leaving plants with no other option but to cease operations. The West Virginia v. EPA decision was the culmination of a years-long, multistate lawsuit against the EPA. The Attorney General‚Äôs Office has continued to push for responsible energy policy.
In October, Attorney General Morrisey led a coalition of 26 states in a letter to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) regarding its proposed rule that would effectively mandate automakers to shift to electric-dominant vehicles. In this rulemaking and another conducted by the EPA, the agencies proposed rules that would have prematurely forced Americans into electric vehicles without considering the consequences.
The Attorney General led the fight against the Biden administration‚Äôs other efforts to illegally impose onerous regulations pertaining to methane and ozone, other greenhouse regulations and more. Among other things, he has secured a temporary stay of new proposed ozone regulations before the Fourth Circuit‚Äîand is launching a new challenge to recently released methane rules.
Attorney General Morrisey spearheaded the opposition to woke Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) policies. He led coalitions in filing multiple comment letters against proposals from the Securities and Exchange Commission to saddle American businesses with crippling ESG-related disclosure requirements. He also fought back against the Commodities Futures Trading Commission and bank regulators when they proposed to do much the same. And he pushed back on bank regulators who sought to impose ESG policies through new enforcement policies. In November, Attorney General Morrisey issued an opinion that will help protect the educational choice rights of parents and students seeking eligibility for the Hope Scholarship Program. He informed county school boards and public schools that they may not take actions against students who are enrolled full-time in public-school programs while also attending privately funded nonpublic-school programs.
The Attorney General wrote, ‚ÄúExcluding students from public schools merely because they are pursuing additional educational opportunities elsewhere would contravene both the United States and West Virginia Constitutions and state statutes. The same is true of any attempt by county school boards or schools to bar students from participating in nonpublic school programs while attending public schools. In February, the Attorney General led a coalition of more than 20 states and other parties in filing a lawsuit against U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives and its director that seeks to enjoin a recently issued final rule governing ‚ÄúStabilizing Braces,‚Äù commonly known as pistol braces.
Attorney General Morrisey achieved a huge victory for the Second Amendment and privacy rights of law-abiding gun owners in West Virginia and across the country when he persuaded Mastercard and Visa to pause applying a new merchant code to distinguish firearms purchases at gun shops.
In June, he joined 23 other state attorneys general challenging the constitutionality of California‚Äôs Unsafe Handgun Act. That law allows handguns for retail sale only if they come with a chamber load indicator, magazine disconnect mechanism and microstamping capability. No handgun sold in the U.S. has all three, and thus, no handguns have been added to the roster since 2013.
The Attorney General maintained concealed carry recognition with an overwhelming majority of states across the nation. The Attorney General was unwavering in his continued fight to protect the lives of unborn babies.
Most notably, he fought to have a lawsuit by an abortion pill manufacturer dismissed. The company argued in their lawsuit that West Virginia‚Äôs new abortion law violates several laws‚Äîthat the state cannot enforce a ‚Äúban‚Äù of a U.S. Food and Drug Administration-approved drug. It wanted the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of West Virginia Huntington Division to find the state‚Äôs abortion law unconstitutional. Instead, the court sided with the Attorney General.
And because of the Office‚Äôs strong defense of the state‚Äôs abortion law, the Women‚Äôs Health Center of West Virginia dropped its lawsuit against the statute. The Attorney General won success for West Virginians in many other areas.
In January, a West Virginia-led coalition secured a key win in a lawsuit from the U.S. Court of Appeals. The decision stemmed from a Biden administration effort in the American Rescue Plan Act to prevent the well-established authority of states to lower taxes for their citizens. This victory played a critical role in allowing West Virginia to deeply cut taxes, while avoiding the possibility of a claw back of federal funds.
He co-led a coalition of 22 states with Louisiana in an amicus brief to the U.S. Supreme Court supporting a broader right to religious accommodations in the workplace. The case involved a Pennsylvania mail carrier‚Äôs right not to work on Sunday in violation of his religious beliefs. The Supreme Court ruled unanimously in the postal worker‚Äôs favor.
In August, the AG joined a bipartisan coalition in urging the U.S. Supreme Court to allow a three-time veteran the full set of education benefits the Montgomery and Post-9/11 GI Bills allow. The coalition argued that a veteran who has served multiple periods of qualifying service under the Montgomery GI Bill and the Post-9/11 GI Bill is entitled to receive a total of 48 months of education benefits‚Äîwithout first exhausting the Montgomery benefit to obtain the more generous post-9/11 benefit.
In October, Attorney General Morrisey joined 33 attorneys general in suing Meta (formerly known as Facebook) in federal court alleging the company knowingly designed and deployed harmful features on its social media platforms that purposefully addict children and teens. At the same time, Meta falsely assured the public that these features are safe and suitable for young users.
In that same month, he wrote a letter to the NCAA on behalf of West Virginia University basketball player RaeQuan Battle. Battle used the transfer portal to transfer to WVU from Montana State, and the NCAA ruled he had to sit out a year. The AG argued that the NCAA‚Äôs ruling was wrong. The NCAA rejected the appeal of its ruling, but the Attorney General continued to work with Battle‚Äôs attorney as well as other attorneys general.
In December, the Attorney General, along with six other states, filed suit against the NCAA, challenging the association‚Äôs Transfer Eligibility Rule. This came on the heels of the NCAA‚Äôs decision to deny Battle a transfer waiver so he could play basketball for West Virginia University. In a huge victory for the rule of law, the court issued a temporary restraining order and ultimately a preliminary injunction against the NCAA to allow student athletes, including Battle and Noah Farrakhan, affected by the transfer rule to play through the winter and spring sports seasons.
An audit in 2023 showed performance continued to improve in the Medicaid Fraud Control Unit (MFCU), which the Attorney General‚Äôs Office took over from DHHR in 2019. Fraud referrals jumped by nearly 58% to 529 cases between 2020 and 2022 under the Attorney General‚Äôs leadership. Total cases opened from referrals went from 138 under DHHR to 339 under the AG‚Äôs Office, an increase of 145.7%. Total recoveries from criminal and civil cases increased 176.16% from $27.28 million under DHHR to $75.34 million under the AG‚Äôs Office. Moreover, the Office implemented cost-effective management of the MFCU‚Äôs financial operations, saving West Virginia taxpayers more than a million dollars in state funds by modestly decreasing expenditures and maximizing the MFCU‚Äôs use of its federal grant funding.
This past October, the AG participated in a $49.5 million, 49-state settlement with software company Blackbaud for its deficient data security practices and response to a 2020 ransomware event that exposed the personal information of millions of consumers across the U.S.
In actions before the U.S. Supreme Court, the Attorney General: In August, he joined a 25-state coalition in a letter to Congress supporting the passage of federal legislation that would preserve students‚Äô access to training that teaches youth best practices, so they do not misuse firearms or other weapons. The Protecting Hunting Heritage and Education Act amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to clarify that the prohibition on the use of federal education funds for certain weapons does not apply to the use of such weapons for training in archery, hunting, or other shooting sports.
Other accomplishments include the following: ‚ÄúThis past year was unprecedented with best in the nation per capita opioid settlements with manufacturers and pharmacies and navigating continued federal overreach by the Biden administration,‚Äù Attorney General Morrisey said. ‚ÄúWhile it‚Äôs great to reflect on our progress, we must also continue to press onward and keep fighting for the people of West Virginia.‚Äù ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot more that needs to be done‚Äîwe have laid a solid foundation upon which we can build another record of success in 2024.‚Äù The post Attorney General Morrisey Shatters Multiple Records for West Virginia in 2023 appeared first on West Virginia Daily News .

title: Lluvias torrenciales en Ecuador: Estragos por inundaciones y da√±os en estructuras
text:
Exclusivo
[Provincias]
Lluvias torrenciales en Ecuador: Estragos por inundaciones y da√±os en estructuras
Inconvenientes en varios sectores de las provincias de Santa Elena, Manab√≠, Los R√≠os y Cotopaxi
Nueve pacientes internados en el hospital de Manglaralto, en la provincia de Santa Elena, fueron trasladados de urgencia al edificio de la Junta Parroquial en medio de la desesperaci√≥n generada por la intensa lluvia que se inici√≥ la noche del martes 4 de marzo y se prolong√≥ hasta la madrugada y ma√±ana de este mi√©rcoles 5 de febrero de 2025.
Por la intensa precipitaci√≥n, el centro de salud qued√≥ inundado, obligando a m√©dicos y pacientes a abandonar el lugar. ‚ÄúFue terrible, llov√≠a con truenos y rel√°mpagos, parec√≠a un diluvio‚Äù, relat√≥ Jacinta Soriano, habitante de Manglaralto.
(Te invitamos a leer:
Decreto 551 | Ley de Alivio Financiero: Condonaci√≥n de deudas, beneficiarios y m√°s)
La lluvia empez√≥ a caer sobre esa parroquia y luego se extendi√≥ por toda la provincia, provocando graves afectaciones en varios sectores, dejando cuantiosos da√±os materiales.
En la comuna Cadeate, las principales calles quedaron anegadas y por ello se suspendi√≥ un festival bailable programado para la noche, para el cierre del feriado de carnaval.
En Libertador Bol√≠var, la fuerza de la corriente del r√≠o Atravesado provoc√≥ el colapso de un puente peatonal. En las localidades Sitio Nuevo, Dos Mangas y El Morrillo, la crecida de sus r√≠os hizo que se quedasen aislados.
La estructura del malec√≥n esc√©nico de Ballenita tambi√©n sufri√≥ da√±os. La corriente de un r√≠o improvisado arrastr√≥ los adoquines hacia el mar. Adem√°s, el √°rea de juegos recreativos se vio afectada por la acumulaci√≥n de agua y lodo.
En La Libertad, adem√°s de calles y viviendas inundadas, los fuertes vientos derribaron un poste que sosten√≠a los sem√°foros en el barrio Abd√≥n Calder√≥n. ‚ÄúLas calles parec√≠an un mar. Gracias a Dios todo pas√≥, aunque muchos no pudimos dormir por temor a que ocurriera algo m√°s grave‚Äù, expres√≥ Jorge Reyes, residente del sector.
Reportaron da√±os en el agro
Wilmer Guale, agricultor de la zona de Colonche, report√≥ p√©rdidas en cultivos de ciclo corto, especialmente ma√≠z y maracuy√°. ‚ÄúLa represa de la comuna San Marcos est√° a punto de colapsar. Si eso ocurre, la situaci√≥n se agravar√≠a a√∫n m√°s, afectando m√°s cultivos‚Äù, advirti√≥.
En la comuna El Az√∫car, otro sector agr√≠cola de la provincia, la intensa lluvia tambi√©n caus√≥ estragos en las plantaciones y da√±√≥ veh√≠culos de los habitantes.
Las autoridades locales han activado equipos de rescate para asistir a las familias afectadas y evaluar los da√±os ocasionados por las lluvias. El Comit√© de Operaciones de Emergencia (COE) Provincial emiti√≥ una alerta para que la ciudadan√≠a tome precauciones ante posibles nuevos aguaceros. Recomienda evitar zonas de riesgo, como r√≠os y quebradas.
Las lluvias, aunque habituales en esta temporada, han expuesto la vulnerabilidad de ciertas infraestructuras y la necesidad de mejorar los sistemas de drenaje en la provincia.
Cultivos anegados en el cant√≥n Rocafuerte, en Manab√≠
‚ÄúAqu√≠ el invierno ha sido devastador, nos ha tocado un invierno implacable que nos ha obligado a evacuar y buscar lugares seguros‚Äù, lament√≥ Diana Zambrano, una de las afectadas por las intensas lluvias sobre el cant√≥n Rocafuerte, provincia de Manab√≠.
Ubicado en el valle del r√≠o Portoviejo, en esta localidad enfrentan inundaciones severas tanto en la zona urbana como rural. Seg√∫n el Comit√© de Operaciones de Emergencia (COE) Cantonal, 2.033 viviendas han resultado afectadas.
Las parroquias rurales han sido las m√°s golpeadas. Sosote encabeza la lista, con 1.524 damnificados y 381 viviendas anegadas. Para movilizarse, los habitantes deben caminar con el agua hasta la cintura, intentando continuar con su cotidianidad.
La econom√≠a del cant√≥n Rocafuerte est√° basada principalmente en la agricultura, actividad que tambi√©n ha sufrido graves da√±os en este sector. Seg√∫n datos oficiales, 1.612,55 hect√°reas de cultivos (arroz, ma√≠z, cacao, pl√°tano, coco) han sido afectadas, lo que compromete la producci√≥n de alimentos y el sustento de cientos de familias.
El alcalde Norberto V√©lez reconoci√≥ la magnitud de la crisis y asegur√≥ que las autoridades locales est√°n trabajando para atender la emergencia. ‚ÄúLas intensas lluvias que estamos enfrentando han generado afectaciones en varios sectores del cant√≥n y en nuestras comunidades‚Äù, se√±al√≥ V√©lez.
Corriente destruy√≥ puente en Cotopaxi
Habitantes del caser√≠o San Francisco de Chipe, en el cant√≥n La Man√°, provincia de Cotopaxi, resultaron afectados por los desbordamientos de los r√≠os San Pablo y Chipe. Cuando se despertaron, el agua estaba ingresando a sus viviendas. Jos√© Villa cont√≥ que gallinas y otros animales se vieron afectados. ‚ÄúSi as√≠ iniciamos, como terminaremos el invierno‚Äù, dijo.
Otro de los lugares afectados es Guasaganda, recinto El Arenal. La tarde del martes 4 de marzo, la creciente del r√≠o se llev√≥ el puente que permit√≠a el acceso a los recintos El Arenal y Capilla. Alrededor de 45 familias se quedaron aisladas, por lo que buscan una carretera para que los lugare√±os puedan sacar sus productos, como la leche y las cosechas.
Juan Salazar, habitante de El Arenal, dijo que su mayor preocupaci√≥n es saber c√≥mo sacar a la venta la leche. Ahora le tocar√° madrugar m√°s para poder llegar a tiempo y entregar el producto.
El agua cubre extensas zonas en Los R√≠os
Alrededor de 100 familias fueron desplazadas debido al desbordamiento del r√≠o Quevedo, que atraviesa el sector El Recreo, al sur de Quevedo, en la provincia de Los R√≠os.
La intensa lluvia se sinti√≥ desde las 02:00 hasta la ma√±ana de este mi√©rcoles 5 de marzo, cuando vieron agua recorrer por varios sectores. Los animales y enseres fueron los que mayormente se afectaron con esta calamidad.
Adem√°s de El Recreo, la inundaci√≥n lleg√≥ a los sectores Cruz Mar√≠a y Puerto L√≥pez, todos ubicados en la parroquia San Camilo. En estas tres zonas las familias estaban tratando de sacar sus pertenencias, en medio de la preocupaci√≥n por el aumento del caudal, que amenaza con llevarse todo a su paso.
En cuesti√≥n de horas las calles de El Recreo, en las que normalmente se ve a ni√±os jugando, estaban cubiertas de agua
La coordinadora de Gesti√≥n de Riesgo Municipal, Lina Lugo, explic√≥ que este problema se debe a que la cota del r√≠o en la represa en la zona de Buena Fe ha alcanzado niveles altos y esto hace que el afluente se rebose.
Alerta ante aumento de caudal de afluentes
Elisa Anchundia Olvera a√∫n est√° sorprendida por el nivel de la inundaci√≥n registrada este a√±o en el recinto El Guayabo del cant√≥n Baba, provincia de Los R√≠os.
En muchas casas ingres√≥ el agua como consecuencia del fuerte temporal invernal, que llev√≥ a las autoridades a declarar en emergencia este territorio, donde existen m√°s de tres mil familias afectadas.
La medida busca gestionar ayudas t√©cnicas para los damnificados, quienes hasta ahora caminan con el agua hasta las rodillas para salir de sus hogares.
Mientras, funcionarios del Cabildo siguen levantando informaci√≥n de los sectores anegados, para llevarles raciones alimenticias.
El Instituto Nacional de Meteorolog√≠a e Hidrolog√≠a (Inamhi) inform√≥ que hasta el cierre de la edici√≥n, en la provincia de Los R√≠os se encuentran desbordados los r√≠os Junquillo, San Pablo, Catarama, Pita, Chilintomo y Babahoyo, adem√°s de los afluentes en la zona norte de la provincia.
Entre los r√≠os que muestran tendencia a desbordarse constan: Arenal, Caracol, Vinces, Pijullo, Baba, Puerto Baja√±a, en el cant√≥n Buena Fe, as√≠ como los r√≠os Salampe y La Reveza, situaci√≥n que tiene en alerta a las autoridades de diversas localidades.
Entre los pron√≥sticos difundidos por el Inamhi consta que para la zona de El Oro, Ca√±ar, Azuay, Loja y Zamora Chinchipe, se registrar√≠an lluvias en la tarde y noche de este mi√©rcoles, as√≠ como durante la madrugada del jueves 6 de marzo.

title: Good Friday 2024 Wishes: Greetings, Quotes, Images, Messages, WhatsApp And Facebook Status To Share With Your Loved Ones
text:
Good Friday 2024 Best Wishes, Greetings: Today on March 29, all the people in the Christian community observe this special day. Christians greatly celebrate Good Friday by remembering the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his ultimate sacrifice for the salvation of humanity. It symbolizes Jesus' enduring love and forgiveness for the sins of mankind, serving as a solemn reminder of his suffering and death on the cross. Christians reflect on themes of forgiveness, compassion, and salvation as they contemplate the profound significance of Jesus' sacrifice on this day.
On Good Friday, people also take time to reflect on their spiritual lives, confess their sins, and express gratitude for receiving redemption through the death and resurrection of Jesus. Christians worldwide observe Good Friday as a pivotal moment in their spiritual journeys, marking it with prayers, worship services, and observances. Here, we have curated wishes, messages, and quotes that you can share with your friends, family, and loved ones.
This day symbolises Jesus' love, forgiveness, and compassion for humanity's sins. (Image Credit: Canva)

title: PM Modi to gift projects worth ‚Çπ22,000 crore to Ayodhya
text:
For Representation Only
The ‚Çπ1463-crore Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram International Airport and the revamped and renamed Ayodhya Dham railway station are among the over ‚Çπ22,000-crore projects that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to gift to Ayodhya during his visit to the temple town on Saturday, said a state government official on Thursday.
Modi‚Äôs visit comes weeks ahead of the much-awaited consecration ceremony of the idol of Ram Lalla (child deity) on January 22 and is part of the government‚Äôs infrastructure push to make Ayodhya a prime religious tourism destination.
Read here: Week-long consecration ceremony of Ram Lalla to kick off from January 16
The projects include those which he will dedicate to the people as well as those for which the foundation stone will be laid.
‚ÄúAll preparations have been made for the Prime Minister‚Äôs Ayodhya visit. The PM will inaugurate Ayodhya International airport and the Ayodhya Dham railway station,‚Äù said Ayodhya divisional commissioner Gaurav Dayal.
The ‚Çπ2183 crore New Ayodhya Township is among the projects for which the prime minister will lay the foundation stone. Spread over 1407 acre on both sides of the Lucknow-Gorakhpur highway, it has been conceptualised to decongest Ayodhya. The new township will have a lake replenished with water of the Saryu to give a spiritual look to the place. It will be extended by 442 acres in the second phase.
As for the airport, the facade of its terminal building is said to reflect the architecture of the Ram Temple.
The interior of the new terminal building is being enlivened with local art from across India, art and paintings depicting the life of Shri Ram. It is proposed to be decorated at different heights to convey a feeling of grandeur of the structure. The first flight to Ayodhya is scheduled to reach at 11.20am after taking off from Delhi at 10 am.
The first phase of the Ayodhya Dham railway station has been completed at a cost of ‚Çπ241 crore.
Modi will also lay the foundation stone of the ‚Çπ300-crore Vashishth Kunj residential project as well for construction of new ghats and beautification of existing ones.

title: Pearl Academy Leads IFFTI India Chapter Inaugural Roundtable to Shape the Future of Design Education
text:
Pearl Academy, established 1993, a leading creative education institution, hosted the prestigious International Foundation of Fashion Technology Institutes (IFFTI) India Chapter Inaugural Roundtable on December 4, 2024 at its Delhi-West campus. With a proud legacy of over 32 years in design education, Pearl Academy continues to lead the way as the only Indian institution to be the Executive Council member of IFFTI, further solidifying its role as a global leader in shaping the future of design education.
The IFFTI India Chapter aimed to unite India‚Äôs top design institutions to build a collaborative network that aligns academic and industry efforts toward creating impactful, future-ready solutions. Fashion institutions like NIFT, UID, IIAD, and others were also represented, alongside attendees from top Delhi schools, colleges, and other prominent bodies. An exceptional lineup of distinguished guests, included esteemed representatives from the New Zealand Embassy, senior members from organisations such as FDCI, ADI, Fashion Revolution, and industry leaders.
The roundtable aligned with the vision of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, emphasising sustainability, digital innovation, and skills development as key drivers for India‚Äôs future. As India continues to position itself at the forefront of global design, the discussions underscored the importance of adapting education to the ever-evolving industry demands. A major outcome of the roundtable was the creation of the IFFTI India Chapter Manifesto, which sets forth a strategic vision for the future of design education. Members agreed to collaborate on digital innovation, sustainability, and skill development, focusing on Indian heritage. India, with its rich and vast history of textiles, aims to align its heritage, art, and culture with these key areas on a global platform. The goal is to showcase India‚Äôs rich legacy while driving innovation in design, sustainability, and skill development, ensuring its prominence on the world stage. This landmark event also laid the foundation for the IFFTI Conference 2027 in India, which will be hosted by Pearl Academy.
Speaking on the significance of the event, Aditi Srivastava, President, Pearl Academy, said, ‚ÄúThis event marks a key milestone in advancing design education in India. As leaders of the IFFTI India Chapter, we are committed to shaping the next generation of creative professionals, equipping them with the skills to thrive in a rapidly changing global landscape. By collaborating with academic institutions, industry leaders, and cultural ambassadors, we aim to showcase India‚Äôs rich heritage on a global platform. Through our focus on digital innovation, sustainability, and skill development, we seek to position India as a hub for sustainable and innovative design education. The IFFTI Conference in 2027 will offer a significant opportunity to further strengthen India‚Äôs role in the global design dialogue, bridging tradition with modernity, preserving culture, and enhancing skills across the design community.‚Äù
